CONJUGATES: catalogs (plural n.) | catalogs (3rd pers. sing. v.) | cataloged (past tense/participle v.) | cataloging (pres. participle v.)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old French catalogue, from Late Latin catalogus, from Greek katalogos 'list, register', from kata- 'down, fully' + legein 'to say, to list'.
SINCE: Late 15th century (as noun), early 17th century (as verb)

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A complete list of items, typically one in alphabetical or other systematic order, often published as a book or pamphlet.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一份系统的物品清单，通常按字母或其他顺序排列，常以书本或小册子形式出版。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The university publishes a catalog detailing all its courses and programs.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 大学出版了一本详细介绍所有课程和项目的目录。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To make a systematic list of (items of the same type); to classify or enter in a catalog.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对（同类物品）进行系统性地列出；编入目录或分类。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Museums meticulously catalog their artifacts to ensure proper record-keeping.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 博物馆一丝不苟地对文物进行编目，以确保记录的准确性。
